title: How many people are waiting for treatment?
analysis_commentary:
As those still waiting for treatment (incomplete pathway) has become the sole measure of treatment waiting times it is important to look at the number of people joining the list and waiting for treatment. In mid-2007, the waiting list contained over 4 million people waiting for treatment. This was reduced drastically to fewer than 2.5 million by winter 2009. Since then, we see a clear seasonal trend with the list being bigger over the summer months and shorter in the winter. Beyond these seasonal changes we can also see an overall upwards trend in the number of people on the waiting list. Since April 2015 there have been more than 3 million people waiting for treatment each month. As of May 2017, there were 3.8 million people waiting for treatment.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Referral to Treatment waiting times
